column5: I just saw the Air Tamarac's Facebook post from June 27th regarding the fires near their cabins 40/41 in Plamondon Baie. Does anyone know the extent of the fire or if any of their property were damaged? Looks pretty scary.https://www.facebook.com/Air-Tamarac-1545781175664572/
Their FB page that you provided link states: "A very fast response from our Canadian Air Tankers saved our camps at Plamondon Bay on Gouin Reservoir - THANKS SOPFEU !!!" Looks good to me. FT

We arrived at Plamondon on the 27th. We were not aware of the fire until we saw the SOPFEU helicopter the same day. At that point the fire had been extinguished. The fire was on an island about 1 mile from the camps. From what we could see (burned trees) from the water it was limited to a small area.
Thanks guys for the update. From the pics it appear the fire was right behind the camp.
A couple of years ago on Red Lake fishing out of Black Bear Lodge we saw the water bombers practicing, Patshorthorn and his son Ben aka Stickman got wet! The fly boys were having some fun!
